definition: to look for a partner
4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
to marry/marriage/wedding/to take a wife

sentences.english: Old goat received an Zhenghun reply.
sentences.chinese: 老色鬼收到了一封徵婚回信。

sentences.english: One of the biggest online industries in India has been the business of arranging marriages.
sentences.chinese: 印度最大的網絡產業來自於徵婚。

sentences.english: The only problem seems to be finding a vicar who is willing to do the ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 還有件麻煩事是有哪位牧師願意來婚禮上徵婚。

sentences.english: Journal Zhenghun by my cousin, wronged a lot of money, but to no avail.
sentences.chinese: 我表哥通過雜誌徵婚，冤枉錢花了不少，卻沒有成效。

sentences.english: His best friend jakob decided to where ads for his release.
sentences.chinese: 他最好的朋友雅克布決定要爲他發佈徵婚啓事。

sentences.english: So, I don't think dating advertisement is reliable.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我不認爲徵婚廣告是可信的。

sentences.english: The universe, he became haining first marriage.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙，他成爲海寧的第一個徵婚者。

sentences.english: Personal ads emphasized plush homes and pretty cars.
sentences.chinese: 個人徵婚廣告強調的是豪宅靚車。

definition: to seek a marriage partner/looking for a mate
to seek new friends through personal ads, dating apps etc
to provide for/to keep (a mistress)
"Mr Perfect" (i.e. tall, rich and handsome) (Internet slang)
announcement (written, on billboard, letter, newspaper or website)/to post information/a notice
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
blind date/arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1])/to be deeply attached to each other
unmarried/single
handsome guy/lady-killer/handsome (form of address)
to come out of the closet/to reveal one's sexual orientation
title/heading/headline/caption/subject
to post (an item on a forum)
to get married soon after meeting (abbr. for 閃電結婚|闪电结婚[shan3 dian4 jie2 hun1]) (neologism c. 2005)
to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
